pull.title: test: check disconnection when sending sendaddrv2 after verack
pull.body:
This PR adds test coverage for:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/71b63195b30b2fa0dff20ebb262ce7566dd5d673/src/net_processing.cpp#L3796-L3807

events.message: test: check disconnection when sending sendaddrv2 after verack

events.body: Tested ACK b4c9ace6ff36c54755e4b12f204212c1b938f509

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -99,6 +100,11 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert addr_receiver.addrv2_received_and_checked
         assert_equal(len(self.nodes[0].getnodeaddresses(count=0, network="i2p")), 0)
 
+        self.log.info('Check disconnection when sending sendaddrv2 after verack')
+        with self.nodes[0].assert_debug_log(['sendaddrv2 received after verack from peer=0; disconnecting']):
+            addr_source.send_message(msg_sendaddrv2())
+            addr_source.wait_for_disconnect()
comments.body: I missed this during review, but it looks like this conflicts with #29575, so it may be better to spin up a new connection and move the code elsewhere to avoid the conflict?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -99,6 +100,11 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert addr_receiver.addrv2_received_and_checked
         assert_equal(len(self.nodes[0].getnodeaddresses(count=0, network="i2p")), 0)
 
+        self.log.info('Check disconnection when sending sendaddrv2 after verack')
+        with self.nodes[0].assert_debug_log(['sendaddrv2 received after verack from peer=0; disconnecting']):
+            addr_source.send_message(msg_sendaddrv2())
+            addr_source.wait_for_disconnect()
comments.body: Yes, I think I can move it to `p2p_leak`, for example.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -99,6 +100,11 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert addr_receiver.addrv2_received_and_checked
         assert_equal(len(self.nodes[0].getnodeaddresses(count=0, network="i2p")), 0)
 
+        self.log.info('Check disconnection when sending sendaddrv2 after verack')
+        with self.nodes[0].assert_debug_log(['sendaddrv2 received after verack from peer=0; disconnecting']):
+            addr_source.send_message(msg_sendaddrv2())
+            addr_source.wait_for_disconnect()
comments.body: You can keep it in the same file. Above `self.log.info('Create connection that sends addrv2 messages')` should be enough to solve the conflict.

@@ -99,6 +100,11 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert addr_receiver.addrv2_received_and_checked
         assert_equal(len(self.nodes[0].getnodeaddresses(count=0, network="i2p")), 0)
 
+        self.log.info('Check disconnection when sending sendaddrv2 after verack')

@@ -89,8 +96,8 @@ def run_test(self):
         msg.addrs = ADDRS
         msg_size = calc_addrv2_msg_size(ADDRS)
         with self.nodes[0].assert_debug_log([
-                f'received: addrv2 ({msg_size} bytes) peer=0',
-                f'sending addrv2 ({msg_size} bytes) peer=1',
+                f'received: addrv2 ({msg_size} bytes) peer=1',
+                f'sending addrv2 ({msg_size} bytes) peer=2',
comments.body: (I think this is a good example of why we shouldn't use `assert_debug_log` when we're able to check the logic otherwise)
